intro: Paronychia przewalskii, commonly known as the Przewalski's paronychia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. Paronychia przewalskii is adapted to rocky and sandy soils, thriving in high-altitude conditions.
